intro: Callicarpa dolichophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white flowers that appear in the spring, followed by vibrant purple berries in the fall. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically 4–8 inches long and have a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in partial to full sunlight and prefers well-drained, moist soil. The berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds and other wildlife, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
